intro: Hahnia aria, commonly known as the slender orchid, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, pale green or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swampy areas. Hahnia aria has a rhizomatous root system and produces showy, spurred orchid flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in association with other wetland plants and is an important component of its native habitat.
